title: Internal compiler error when running with `entr -r cargo run`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
When I run a long-running process using `entr -r cargo run` (where `entr` is http://eradman.com/entrproject/), the compiler dies with an internal compiler error. I don't know what's special with how entr runs cargo compared to how it's normally run. ### Code ```Rust fn main() { println!("Hello World"); std::thread::sleep(std::time::Duration::from_secs(10)); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.40.0 (73528e339 2019-12-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 73528e339aae0f17a15ffa49a8ac608f50c6cf14 commit-date: 2019-12-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.40.0 LLVM version: 9.0 ``` ### Error output ``` martin@ubun /tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv $ find src | entr -r cargo run Compiling tmp v0.1.0 (/tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv) thread '' panicked at 'failed to acquire jobserver token: early EOF on jobserver pipe', src/librustc_codegen_ss a/back/write.rs:1401:29 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.40.0 (73528e339 2019-12-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden error: failed to acquire jobserver token: early EOF on jobserver pipe error: aborting due to previous error error: could not compile `tmp`. To learn more, run the command again with --verbose. ```
Backtrace

``` martin@ubun /tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv $ find src | RUST_BACKTRACE=1 entr -r cargo run --verbose Compiling tmp v0.1.0 (/tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv) Running `rustc --edition=2018 --crate-name tmp src/main.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi --cr ate-type bin --emit=dep-info,link -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=c21f1704f6025fec -C extra-filename=-c21f1704f6025fec --out- dir /tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv/target/debug/deps -C incremental=/tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv/target/debug/incremental -L depen dency=/tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv/target/debug/deps` thread '' panicked at 'failed to acquire jobserver token: early EOF on jobserver pipe', src/librustc_codegen_ss a/back/write.rs:1401:29 stack backtrace: 0: backtrace::backtrace::libunwind::trace at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.40/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:88 1: backtrace::backtrace::trace_unsynchronized at /cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/backtrace-0.3.40/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66 2: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print_fmt at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:77 3: ::fmt at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:61 4: core::fmt::write at src/libcore/fmt/mod.rs:1028 5: std::io::Write::write_fmt at src/libstd/io/mod.rs:1412 6: std::sys_common::backtrace::_print at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:65 7: std::sys_common::backtrace::print at src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:50 8: std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}} at src/libstd/panicking.rs:188 9: std::panicking::default_hook at src/libstd/panicking.rs:205 10: rustc_driver::report_ice 11: std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook at src/libstd/panicking.rs:468 12: std::panicking::continue_panic_fmt at src/libstd/panicking.rs:373 13: std::panicking::begin_panic_fmt at src/libstd/panicking.rs:328 14: rustc_codegen_ssa::back::write::start_executing_work::{{closure}} note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports note: rustc 1.40.0 (73528e339 2019-12-16) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: failed to acquire jobserver token: early EOF on jobserver pipe error: aborting due to previous error error: could not compile `tmp`. Caused by: process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --edition=2018 --crate-name tmp src/main.rs --error-format=json --json=diagno stic-rendered-ansi --crate-type bin --emit=dep-info,link -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=c21f1704f6025fec -C extra-filename=- c21f1704f6025fec --out-dir /tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv/target/debug/deps -C incremental=/tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv/target/deb ug/incremental -L dependency=/tmp/martin.tmp.FAjPzdkv/target/debug/deps` (exit code: 1) ```
